lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm sm dyiK smdrsI huie AkQ kQw bIcwr hwir moinDwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Sam Daykhi Samadarasee Hui , Akad Kadaa Beechaar Haari Monidhaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A pursuant disciple of the True Guru feels the presence of Lord Almighty in every living being and at all places, becomes impartial and instead of indulging in discussions of Lord's visible plays and performances, remains engrossed in Him.

lines.gurmukhi: honhwr hoie qwN qy Awsw qy inrws Bey kwrn krn pRB jwin haumY mwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Honahaar Hoi Taan Tay Aasaa Tay Niraas Bhaay , Kaaran Karan Prabh Jaani Haoumai Maaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whatever is happening, is happening in His will. Thus such a disciple remains unsullied of all his desire. Knowing the traits of the Almighty who is the cause and effect of everything, he loses his pride and ego in accordance with immortal saying of Gurba

lines.gurmukhi: sUKm sQUl EAMkwr kY Akwr huie bHm ibbyk buD Bey bHmcwrI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sookham Sadool Aoankaar Kai Akaar Hui , Braham Bibayk Budh Bhaay Brahamachaaree Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He accepts that all big or small forms have come out of One Lord. Adopting the divine wisdom, he becomes Godly in character.

lines.gurmukhi: bt bIj ko ibQwr bHm kY mwieAw CwieAw gurmuiK eyk tyk duibDw invwrI hY ]458]
lines.transliteration_english: Bat Beej Ko Bidaar Braham Kai Maaiaa Chhaaiaa , Gurmukhi Ayk Tayk Doubidhaa Nivaaree Hai ?458?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a well-spread banyan tree is born out of a seed, so is His form spreading around in the form of maya. An obedient Sikh of the Guru removes his duality by learning heavily on this one support. (He is never enamored by any god or goddess since he kn
